title: ICE in nightly compiling Rocket master

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
This is minimized as much as I could from an ICE arising from compiling the [HEAD of master as of today](https://github.com/SergioBenitez/Rocket/tree/c24f15c18f02319be83af4f3c1951dc220b52c5e) of [Rocket](https://github.com/SergioBenitez/Rocket). The error messages stayed the same throughout minimization, but upon resolving the issue, it would be good to also test that issuing `cargo build` inside of `core/lib` in Rocket also compiles. Although this has been minimized on Windows, the original ICE occurred on an Ubuntu Github Actions CI Server. ### Code ```Rust macro_rules! info { (target: $target:expr, $($arg:tt)+) => ( () ); ($($arg:tt)+) => ( () ) } macro_rules! log_ { ($name:ident: $($args:tt)*) => { $name!(target: "_", $($args)*) }; } macro_rules! info_ { ($($args:expr),+) => { log_!(info: $($args),+); }; } fn main() { async { // No error info_!(""); match Result::<(),()>::Ok(()) { // Errors Ok(()) => info_!(""), Err(()) => info_!(""), } }; } ``` ### Meta `rustc +nightly --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.51.0-nightly (04caa632d 2021-01-30) binary: rustc commit-hash: 04caa632dd10c2bf64b69524c7f9c4c30a436877 commit-date: 2021-01-30 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.51.0-nightly LLVM version: 11.0.1 ``` ### Error output ``` Compiling ice-attempt v0.1.0 (C:\Users\jon\repos\ice-attempt) warning: unused implementer of `Future` that must be used --> src\main.rs:14:5 | 14 | / async { 15 | | // No error 16 | | info_!(""); 17 | | match Result::<(),()>::Ok(()) { ... | 21 | | } 22 | | }; | |______^ | = note: `#[warn(unused_must_use)]` on by default = note: futures do nothing unless you `.await` or poll them warning: Error finalizing incremental compilation session directory `\\?\C:\Users\jon\repos\ice-attempt\target\debug\incremental\ice_attempt-1u7zclevihugp\s-fvq2o5hk8t-1d3ihh7-working`: The system cannot find the file specified. (os error 2) warning: 2 warnings emitted error: internal compiler error: failed to process buffered lint here --> src\main.rs:11:68 | 11 | macro_rules! info_ { ($($args:expr),+) => { log_!(info: $($args),+); }; } | ^ ... 19 | Ok(()) => info_!(""), | ---------- in this macro invocation | = note: delayed at /rustc/04caa632dd10c2bf64b69524c7f9c4c30a436877\compiler\rustc_lint\src\early.rs:384:18 = note: this error: internal compiler error originates in a macro (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info) error: internal compiler error: failed to process buffered lint here --> src\main.rs:11:68 | 11 | macro_rules! info_ { ($($args:expr),+) => { log_!(info: $($args),+); }; } | ^ ... 20 | Err(()) => info_!(""), | ---------- in this macro invocation | = note: delayed at /rustc/04caa632dd10c2bf64b69524c7f9c4c30a436877\compiler\rustc_lint\src\early.rs:384:18 = note: this error: internal compiler error originates in a macro (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'no errors encountered even though `delay_span_bug` issued', compiler\rustc_errors\src\lib.rs:974:13 ```
Backtrace

``` stack backtrace: 0: 0x7ff95e1f9755 - ::fmt::h07eb7c6246901ad5 1: 0x7ff95e225fdb - core::fmt::write::ha3ea633b18d2da75 2: 0x7ff95e1ec08d - ::fmt::h8573cdc9b491acbf 3: 0x7ff95e1fd8fd - std::panicking::take_hook::h462942ea222a8ec2 4: 0x7ff95e1fd3c9 - std::panicking::take_hook::h462942ea222a8ec2 5: 0x7ff9564796f7 - rustc_driver::report_ice::hc33e4d260fbc44ec 6: 0x7ff95e1fe362 - std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook::h18985e2f09a20bf1 7: 0x7ff95e1fde51 - rust_begin_unwind 8: 0x7ff95e1fa12f - ::fmt::h07eb7c6246901ad5 9: 0x7ff95e1fdda9 - rust_begin_unwind 10: 0x7ff95e1fdd5c - std::panicking::begin_panic_fmt::h1e00459759aac2c8 11: 0x7ff95ab12744 - rustc_errors::HandlerInner::delay_as_bug::ha06953acff9f7d8d 12: 0x7ff95ab0deb4 - ::drop::h32f0e30ae1a18e6e 13: 0x7ff9564935a7 - ::fmt::h29458aa7f6b0c34e 14: 0x7ff95649a00a - ::fmt::h29458aa7f6b0c34e 15: 0x7ff95649503c - ::fmt::h29458aa7f6b0c34e 16: 0x7ff95647c264 - ::fmt::h29458aa7f6b0c34e 17: 0x7ff9563ec95c - ::check_and_note_conflicting_crates::AbsolutePathPrinter as rustc_middle::ty::print::Printer>::print_type::h3de678dd541c9b13 18: 0x7ff95648ac8b - ::fmt::h29458aa7f6b0c34e 19: 0x7ff95641c77d - rustc_driver::pretty::print_after_hir_lowering::h9432b6a55607de6b 20: 0x7ff95e20e0ca - std::sys::windows::thread::Thread::new::ha39cc759d7fbecd8 21: 0x7ff9eceb7034 - BaseThreadInitThunk 22: 0x7ff9edf7d0d1 - RtlUserThreadStart ```

### Other notes from attempts to minimize further * If I change the log messages to point directly to the log_ macro, the ICE goes away. * The async block is required, even though the future isn't being awaited.
